titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Fagel Stern Papers TAM.091

editionstmt.p: This version was derived from STERN-F Guide.wpd

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-03-23T15:03-0400

change.item: edited by Nicole Greenhouse for compliance with DACS and Tamiment Required Elements for Archival Description

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: Faygle Stern (circa 1904-1936) was a Polish Jewish communist active in the Jewish Section of the International Workers Order in New York. She came to the United States in 1921, and died in childbirth in January, 1936. The collection includes her diary, correspondence with her brother Abram Judah, a communist who lived in Havana and the USSR, and biographical material (reminiscence, sketch, obituary). The diary, notebooks, and most of the letters are in Yiddish.
did.langmaterial: The diary, notebooks, and most of the letters are in Yiddish. The rest of the collection is in English.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Phyllis Stern (niece of Fagel Stern), 1990.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Faygle Stern (circa 1904-1936), was a Jewish communist active in the Jewish Section of the International Workers Order, primarily as a teacher in the Yiddish shule movement in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn, New York. She was born in Ostroleka (a.k.a. Ostrolenka), Poland, came to the United States in 1921, and died in childbirth in January, 1936.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains Stern's diary; two notebooks with comments on Jews, Zionism, and world affairs; correspondence from family members, friends, and colleagues; and photographs. The collection also contains biographical material.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: Box 1 of this collection are photocopies of the original materials in Box 2.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Photographs were separated from this collection during initial processing and were established as a separate collection, the Fagel Stern Photographs (PHOTOS 177). In 2013, the photograph collection was reincorporated into the Fagel Stern Papers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Folders are arranged alphabetically by subject/author.

The files are grouped into two series:
Series I: Papers
Series II: Photographs

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note
phystech.p: Due to the fragile nature of the original documents, patrons are required to use the access photocopies.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain in 2103. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Fagel Stern Papers; TAM 091; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This series contains Stern's diary, maintained during her fatal pregnancy, in which personal and political concerns are co-mingled. The series also contains her political notebooks; letters from her brother Abram Judah, also a communist who lived in Havana before returning to the USSR, where he died in 1933; letters from her brother Beryl, who came to the U.S. from Ostrolenka in 1935, and letters from her brother Chiel, who remained in Poland. The collection also contains biographical material on Stern including a reminiscence, sketch, and obituary.

did.unittitle: Stern, Abram Judah (Idl) - letters from Cuba to Fagel Stern
Stern, Abram Judah (Idl) and Fagel Stern - Immigration to United States - Documents.
Stern, Beryl - letters to Fagel Stern.
Stern, Beryl - letter from R.Saltzman, National Secretary, Jewish Section, International Workers Order.
Stern, Chiel - letters to Fagel and Beryl Stern.
Stern, Fagel - letters to Abram and Beryl Stern.
Stern, Naftali (uncle of Fagel) - letter to Fagel Stern.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This series contains four items, including two black-and-white prints and two letters. Both photographs include Fagel Stern, dated 1924. Both letters are addressed to Phyllis Stern.
